results.title: India and Pakistan Agree to Cease-Fire but Clashes Persist
results.abstract: The truce came after several days of the countries’ most expansive fighting in decades. One Indian official said the country would “deal strongly” with any violations.

results.title: Leo XIV Outlines a Path for a Modern Church That Follows Francis’ Steps
results.abstract: The new pope said he would be guided by a key document that his predecessor wrote listing the church’s priorities, including a “loving care for the least and the rejected.”

results.title: The Trade War’s Impact on Your Barbecue: Pricier Burgers
results.abstract: Americans are eating record amounts of Brazilian beef. Now, tariffs and trade wars could push up U.S. prices and send more of it to China.

results.title: World Catholics See the First American Pope as Hardly American
results.abstract: Catholics around the world were skeptical at first about an American pope. But Pope Leo XIV’s multicultural and multilingual identity has put them at ease.

results.title: Europe Wants to Arm Ukraine, but It’s Losing a Race Against Time
results.abstract: President Trump’s insistence that the United States do less toward securing Europe means that allies, scrambling to arm themselves, have less to give to Ukraine.

results.title: Voice of Lay Catholics Is Likely to Be Heard in Leo XIV’s Church
results.abstract: When still a cardinal, the new pope led discussions on key issues facing the church during which “every voice had equal value,” whether an archbishop or an unordained believer.

results.title: In Pope Leo, Some in MAGA Movement See an Antagonist
